title: US, Japan Hold Joint Flight Drills Amid Rising Tensions With China

title: 6.7 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Japan, Tsunami Warning Issued
content: The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), upgrading its initial estimated magnitude of 6.5, also warned that tsunami waves of up to one metre (three feet) could hit the northern Pacific coastline.

title: Goa Club Fire LIVE Updates: Thailand Begins Deportation Process Of Luthras
content: Goa Nightclub Fire Tragedy LIVE News Updates: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who fled India following a fire at their nightclub in Goa that killed 25 people, were detained on Thursday morning.

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday greeted superstar Rajinikanth on his 75th birthday and said his work has consistently set benchmarks.

title: Former Lok Sabha Speaker Shivraj Patil Dies At 90
content: Senior Congress leader and former Union Home Minister Shivraj Patil passed away at his home town Latur in Maharashtra on Friday morning.

title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, Man Wrongly Deported To El Salvador, Freed
content: Kilmar Abrego Garcia was freed from immigration detention on a judge's order while he fights to stay in the US, handing a major victory to the immigrant whose wrongful deportation made him a flashpoint of Trump administration's immigration crackdown.

content: Three people have been arrested in connection with the assault of a man selling chicken patties near the massive Bhagavad Gita recital in Kolkata on Sunday

title: Indian Artefacts Among 600 "High Value" Items Stolen From UK Museum
content: Many artefacts from India dating back to the British Colonial era are among more than 600 "high value" items that were stolen during a burglary at a museum in Bristol.

title: Disney Invests $1 Billion In OpenAI, Licenses Over 200 Characters For Use In Sora
content: Walt Disney and OpenAI announced a three-year licensing deal Thursday that will allow users to create short videos featuring beloved Disney characters through artificial intelligence.

title: "He Is Constantly Shaking Hands": White House On Trump's Bandaged Hand
content: The White House said Thursday the high volume of handshakes by President Donald Trump explains the adhesive bandages he has worn on the back of his right hand in recent days.

title: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal Says US Trade Negotiations 'Progressing Well'
content: The US should sign the free trade agreement with India on the "dotted lines" if Washington is happy with what has been offered by New Delhi, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Thursday.

title: Thailand PM Dissolves Parliament After 3 Months In Office
content: Thailand's Prime Minister dissolved parliament on Friday after three months in office, a royal decree showed, paving the way for general elections early next year.

title: El Salvador To Deploy Musk's Grok In Over 5,000 Public Schools
content: El Salvador will use Grok, the alleged "Holocaust-denying" AI chatbot of social platform X, in public school education in a world first, President Nayib Bukele and X boss Elon Musk announced Thursday.

title: WHO Rejects Claims Of Link Between Vaccines And Autism
content: A new analysis by the World Health Organization reaffirmed there is no link between vaccines and autism -- contrary to theories being propagated in the United States.

title: Mexico Hits India With 50% Tariffs. This Will Be Most Impacted Sector
content: After the United States, Mexico has decided to impose tariffs as high as 50 per cent on the import of select goods from India and other Asian nations that do not have a trade deal with Mexico City.

title: US Man Kills Mother, Stabs Self, Family Blames ChatGPT For Murder-Suicide
content: The estate of an 83-year-old Connecticut woman filed a wrongful death lawsuit Thursday against OpenAI and Microsoft, alleging the ChatGPT chatbot fueled her son's paranoid delusions and contributed to her murder.

title: Sanctions To Military Action, How US-Venezuela Relations Have Worsen
content: The seizure of an oil tanker off Venezuela's coast this week comes after long-standing tensions between Washington and Caracas, starting with US sanctions in 2006 and most recently strikes against alleged drug-smuggling boats.

title: Explained: Why Delhi-NCR Is Not Experiencing The Signature Winter Cold Wave
content: A third of December has already passed, but the intense winter chill has not yet arrived in the Delhi-NCR region.

title: India Witnessing Cultural Renaissance After Long Time: J&K Lt Governor
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha called on youngsters, writers and thinkers on Thursday to lead the country to new heights like visionary craftsmen, saying India is witnessing a cultural renaissance after a long time.

content: The High Court must clarify whether the method of the Collegium‚Äôs recommendations in the case of recent judicial appointments was in accordance with the Constitution and the Memorandum of Procedure

title: Court to pronounce sentence in Kerala actor rape case on December 12
content: The Ernakulam Principal Sessions Court will hear the arguments of the counsels of the convicts and the prosecution during the forenoon session

content: Police registered a case against him on charge of molesting a woman associated with the film industry while staying at a hotel as part of the Malayalam movie selection process for IFFK

content: The Central agency has filed a charge sheet against 13 accused persons in a major digital arrest case; it found that several key bank accounts used for receiving money from victims and routing the funds were being controlled by masterminds based in Cambodia, Hong Kong, and China

content: The deceased‚Äôs widow and brother gave conflicting statements about who was responsible for the tragedy.

content: e-Courts project includes ‚Çπ53.57 cr for future tech, including AI and blockchain; AI tools to boost administrative efficiency, predict case pendency, automate processes, streamline court operations, Minister says

title: PM Modi to visit Jordan, Ethiopia, Oman from December 15 to 18
content: In the first leg of his trip, PM Modi will visit Jordan from December 15 to 16 at the invitation of King Abdullah II bin Al Hussein to review the entire gamut of bilateral relations and exchange perspectives on regional issues.

title: Srinagar homestay owner booked for hosting Chinese national
content: The police lodged a FIR (First Information Report) under Sections 8 and 23(b) of the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025

title: 76.08% vote in second phase of local body polls,  Kerala records overall turnout of 73.69%
content: Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur and Kasaragod went to the polls on Thursday (December 11) and 1.16 crore of the 1.53 crore voters in these districts exercised their right to vote.

content: Kozhikode¬†Corporation registered 69.55% polling; Ramanattukara¬†posted the highest polling percentage of 81.39 among municipalities, while¬†Payyoli recorded the lowest  of 76.53%

title: Five gau rakshaks held for beating digital creator over feeding chicken to a cow; victim also held
content: Gurugram Police spokesperson said that Ritik Chandna had accepted a challenge to eat a hundred momos and was live streaming it when he fed the chicken momos to a cow at the request of an audience member

title: Supreme Court says ‚Äòmigration‚Äô in SIR order may include illegal crossings into India
content: Bench questions scope of Election Commission‚Äôs citizenship verification under nationwide SIR exercise

content: Sources confirmed that for the eight vacancies as Information Commissioners, the government had recommended one name from the SC community, one from the ST community, one member from the Other Backward Classes¬†and a member of a minority community, and a woman

title: Indian Medical Parliamentarians‚Äô Forum flags acute crisis in care for children with rare lysosomal disorders
content: In a submission to Prime Minister, the forum has warned that treatment interruptions under the National Policy for Rare Diseases have placed dozens of young patients at immediate and preventable risk

title: President Murmu visits Manipur amid shutdown
content: After the capital of the conflict-scarred State, she is scheduled to visit Senapati district to inaugurate various developmental projects

title: NIMHANS paper highlights role of digital tools in strengthening campus mental health systems
content: The publication says higher education institutions must put in place clear policies on data governance, privacy and confidentiality, and ensure transparency around digital offerings

title: Watch: Historic chaos in Maharashtra Assembly: No opposition leader for the first time
content: In this episode of Pulse Maharashtra, we decode the unprecedented turmoil in the winter session: why both Houses currently lack an LOP, how the 10% convention is being interpreted, and what the number game looks like (Shiv Sena UBT, Congress, NCP‚ÄìSP).

title: Redeploy non-Hindus in non-religious positions, government tells TTD
content: The TTD administration is also contemplating introducing Voluntary Retirement Scheme by working out a lucrative package for them

title: Punishment for forcibly administering acid must be stricter than under UAPA : SC
content: ‚ÄúThese people who exhibit such barbarism on a fellow human being have no right to roam around in society; they are a threat to society and to the rule of the law,‚Äù says Chief Justice Surya Kant

title: Family rift widens as Lalu's daughter appeals to Nitish Kumar for 'safe home'
content: Lalu Prasad's daughter, Rohini Acharya, has voiced concerns about women's safety in Bihar, advocating for parental homes to be secure havens.  Her appeal follows a public fallout with her family, where she alleged accusations of ulterior motives behind her kidney donation to her father. Acharya believes societal and political shifts are crucial to protect women from exploitation.

title: Former Union home minister Shivraj Patil passes away at 90; PM Modi condoles loss
content: Veteran Congress leader Shivraj Patil, 90, has died at his Latur home after a brief illness. A seven-time MP from Latur, he served as Lok Sabha Speaker (1991‚Äì1996) and Union home minister (2004‚Äì2008), resigning after the 26/11 attacks. Patil also held multiple ministerial portfolios and was Governor of Punjab (2010‚Äì2015). He is survived by his son, daughter-in-law, and two granddaughters.

title: ‚ÄòI stand with every Hindu‚Äô: Bengal LoP ‚Äòhonours‚Äô men who attacked food vendors; trio gets bail
content: West Bengal's Leader of the Opposition, Suvendu Adhikari, felicitated three men arrested for assaulting chicken patty vendors at a religious event, shortly after their bail. Adhikari stated his primary duty is to protect his dharma and Hindu brothers and sisters, asserting his legal team facilitated their release.

title: South Africa create history; become most successful team against India in T20Is
content: India suffered a significant 51-run T20I defeat to South Africa, leveling the series and marking their most losses against any opponent. South African pacers achieved a rare feat, taking all ten wickets. India's inability to chase over 210 and the large margin of loss highlight persistent challenges ahead of the T20 World Cup.

title: Fled by IndiGo, caught at Indigo: How Luthra brothers‚Äô escape plan crumbled; deportation next
content: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, co-owners of Goa‚Äôs fire-ravaged nightclub Birch by Romeo Lane, were detained by Thai police in Phuket after fleeing India following a blaze that killed 25. With passports suspended, they were tracked and held in immigration custody. Indian authorities aim to deport them within four days. Police continue investigating, having already arrested six staff members linked to the fire.

title: Oracle stumbles: AI bets strain finances; shares drop after historic surge
content: Oracle's stock experienced a significant drop after reporting quarterly results that missed revenue expectations, largely due to substantial spending on data centers for AI customers like OpenAI. The company's heavy reliance on a massive OpenAI deal and its debt-fueled expansion have raised investor concerns about its financial stability and future growth prospects.

title: Rupee tumbles to fresh life-time low! Reaches to 90.52 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee hit a record low of 90.52 against the US dollar on Friday, extending its sharp decline this year. This weakness is attributed to a widening trade deficit, strong corporate dollar demand, and US tariffs. The Reserve Bank of India has intervened to stabilize the currency, which has lost over 5% this year.

title: Foxtail millet, gongura paneer & more: PM hosts NDA MPs; what was on the all-vegetarian menu
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted NDA MPs for a special dinner featuring a diverse vegetarian menu, highlighting regional flavours and millet-based dishes. The gathering followed the NDA's significant victory in the Bihar Assembly elections. MPs expressed optimism for future successes, with one predicting the next celebratory meal after West Bengal polls.

title: ‚ÄòRs 5 lakh will become Rs 2.5cr‚Äô: 3 men die in occult ritual; one body found with lemon in mouth
content: Three men, including a businessman, died mysteriously at a farmhouse in Korba, Chhattisgarh. The incident involved alleged occult practices and a money-doubling fraud. Police detained five individuals, including an occult practitioner. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of death, examining forensic evidence and financial dealings. The deaths have caused shock and anxiety in the region.

title: Google accused of mass IP misuse: Disney sends cease-and-desist notice - what the letter says
content: Disney has inked a multi-billion dollar deal with OpenAI, allowing Sora AI users to create videos featuring Disney, Marvel, Pixar, and Star Wars characters. This announcement followed a 'Cease-and-Desist' letter sent to Google, accusing its AI models of massive copyright infringement on Disney's intellectual property, including characters from popular franchises.

title: Kant, gaming jargon ‚Äî and outrage: South Korea's 'impossible' English test goes viral; exam chief quits
content: South Korea's exam chief resigned after the English section of the national university entrance exam was criticized for being too difficult. The test's absolute grading system saw its lowest top-grade achievement since 2018, with many students and educators deeming the questions overly specialized and convoluted. This unusual resignation highlights the intense pressure surrounding the Suneung exam.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,950; BSE Sensex up over 300 points
content: Indian equity benchmarks Nifty50 and BSE Sensex opened higher on Friday, reversing Thursday's downward trend. Despite continued selling by foreign institutional investors, domestic institutional investors' strong buying and steady mutual fund SIP inflows are providing support. Investors are awaiting key economic data releases.

title: Amazon layoffs: VP explains 14,000 jobs cuts; leaders push ‚Äòbiggest startup‚Äô vision
content: Amazon's senior vice president Amit Agarwal stated that recent layoffs are aimed at removing organizational layers to foster agility, enabling the company to operate like a startup in an AI-driven world. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts are culture-driven, not financially or AI-driven, to streamline operations and empower employees.

title: 'We learn‚Ä¶ we try': Suryakumar Yadav scrambles for answers after heavy defeat
content: India's T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav acknowledged a "far from good enough" performance after a significant defeat to South Africa.  He highlighted early wickets and a muddled batting strategy, admitting the team's over-reliance on Abhishek Sharma.  Despite acknowledging bowling struggles with dew, Yadav stressed the team's commitment to learning and improving for future matches.

title: Fatty liver to arthritis: Gut expert warns of quiet symptoms you must not ignore
content: Gastroenterologist Dr. Saurabh Sethi highlights that early health changes are often missed due to our fast-paced lives. He urges attention to subtle body signals like brain fog, post-meal fatigue, and morning stiffness, which can indicate serious conditions such as thyroid dysfunction, Type 2 diabetes, and autoimmune diseases before they become severe.

title: California man kept in refrigerator for days after 33 drinks on Royal Caribbean ship
content: A wrongful death lawsuit against Royal Caribbean alleges a California man died after a violent restraint by ship security following severe intoxication. His body was reportedly kept in a refrigerator for the remainder of a three-day cruise. The autopsy ruled his death a homicide due to mechanical asphyxiation associated with restraint.

title: IBPS, SBI, RRBs: FinMin announces major recruitment reforms; what candidates must know
content: The Finance Ministry has introduced major reforms to streamline recruitment examinations and result declarations for SBI, NBs and RRBs through IBPS. Officer-level results will now be announced first, followed by clerical-level results, with a standardised sequence across banks. The changes aim to enhance transparency, reduce attrition, and allow candidates to make informed choices. The move addresses operational challenges arising from workforce migration and ensures more predictable, stable recruitment in public sector banks, as quoted by the PTI.

title: Gas explosion hits San Francisco: Footage shows fireball-like eruption ‚Äì video
content: A gas explosion, triggered by a construction crew damaging an underground line, devastated a community near Hayward. The blast destroyed a home, blew out windows, and sent six people to the hospital. Firefighters battled flames and fallen power lines as the National Transportation Safety Board launched an investigation into the incident.

title: We don't go by external rankings on climate, pollution: Govt
content: India prioritizes its own assessments for environmental policy over external global rankings on pollution and climate resilience. The Environment Ministry stated it doesn't recognize foreign reports like the Global Climate Risk Index or IQAir's air quality rankings as a basis for domestic policy. Instead, the nation relies on its own initiatives like 'Swachh Vayu Survekshan' for evaluating progress.

title: ‚Äò25k people died last month‚Äô: Trump hints at third world war as Russia-Ukraine talks falter - watch
content: President Trump issued a grave warning about the Russia-Ukraine war, fearing it could escalate into a third world war. He expressed deep frustration with stalled peace talks, urging an immediate halt to fighting. European leaders are now stepping in to shape negotiations, while battlefield pressures mount. Trump insists swift action is crucial to prevent a wider global conflict.

title: Paige Shiver‚Äôs net worth: 55% salary hike and link to Sherrone Moore scandal fuel speculation
content: University of Michigan football is in turmoil as executive assistant Paige Shiver faces intense public scrutiny. Her name is linked to former coach Sherrone Moore's firing and police detainment due to alleged inappropriate relationship rumors. Shiver's recent significant salary increase and social media silence have fueled speculation amid the ongoing investigation.

title: Troy Aikman blasts FOX leadership, cites ‚Äòlack of communication‚Äô for exit
content: Troy Aikman explained his departure from FOX Sports was due to a breakdown in communication, not a lack of platform or money. He stated that key executives, including CEO Eric Shanks, failed to provide clarity on his contract status. Aikman revealed he never received a final offer from FOX, only congratulations after signing with ESPN.

title: Venus Williams & Andrea Preti net worth 2025: Career, family & business
content: Venus Williams boasts an estimated $95 million net worth in 2025, primarily from her legendary tennis career and successful fashion and design businesses. Her partner, Andrea Preti, an actor and businessman, contributes an estimated $1-2 million. Together, their combined net worth is approximately $96-97 million, reflecting their individual financial achievements.

title: ‚ÄòKept saying we‚Äôre Indian, they didn't listen‚Äô: Pregnant woman recounts deportation
content: A pregnant domestic worker, Sunali Khatun, recounts her harrowing experience of being deported to Bangladesh despite possessing Indian identity documents. Detained during an identity verification drive, she and her family were allegedly pushed across the border, leading to months of hardship and fear. Her father's legal intervention highlights the family's desperate plea for justice.

title: 6.7-magnitude earthquake jolts northern Japan; tsunami warning issued
content: A 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck Japan's Aomori coast, prompting a tsunami warning for waves up to 1 meter. While no immediate damage or casualties are reported, this follows a powerful 7.5 magnitude quake earlier in the week. Authorities had previously cautioned about the possibility of further significant tremors in the region.

title: All in 1 night: Andhra man steals 110 pigs, sells for Rs 3 lakh
content: Police in Chikkaballapura district have arrested a man for allegedly stealing over a hundred pigs in a single night. The accused, who operated his own piggery, confessed to the massive theft and revealed he had already sold the livestock. Authorities recovered Rs 3 lakh in cash and are now pursuing his four accomplices and the vehicles used in the heist.

title: U19 Asia Cup: 'Explicit instructions' - Sooryavanshi & handshake in focus as India face Pak
content: India's U-19 Asia Cup campaign faces scrutiny over whether players will shake hands with Pakistan, a gesture previously omitted in senior tournaments. The BCCI's stance on this sporting courtesy at the junior level remains a key point of attention, with the ICC preferring to keep politics separate from youth cricket.

title: Andhra Pradesh pilgrimage turns tragic: 9 dead as bus falls into gorge; rescue ops launched
content: A tragic accident occurred on the Chinturu‚ÄìMaredumilli ghat road when a private travel bus carrying pilgrims fell into a gorge, resulting in at least 9 deaths and several injuries. The bus, en route to Annavaram from Bhadrachalam, veered off the road due to a sharp curve. Rescue efforts were delayed by poor mobile network coverage in the hilly terrain.

title: Amid trade deal push, PM, Trump get on call
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Trump held a productive conversation, reaffirming bilateral cooperation and discussing regional and global issues. The call signals renewed engagement, with progress noted in most areas except trade, where US tariffs remain a point of contention. Both leaders emphasized continued collaboration for global peace and prosperity.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Eternal and Divi's Laboratories as top stock picks for December 12, 2025. Nifty is expected to trade between 25,700-26,200, while Bank Nifty may consolidate in the 58,500-60,100 range.

title: Paige Shiver abortion claim sparks scrutiny on Sherrone Moore‚Äôs firing, arrest
content: Michigan football faces a deepening scandal surrounding former coach Sherrone Moore, whose firing for an inappropriate relationship escalated with viral claims of coercion and a forced abortion involving staffer Paige Shiver.  The university's swift action and police involvement fuel speculation about the true severity of the allegations, leaving the public questioning what remains unsaid.

title: 2nd T20I defeat: 'Gill & SKY's form?' - Gambhir and co asked to 'answer'
content: India suffered a 51-run defeat to South Africa in the second T20I, raising concerns over Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav's form. The team's bowling discipline also faltered, with numerous full tosses and expensive overs contributing to South Africa's 213/4. India's chase collapsed early, falling short at 162 despite Tilak Varma's 62.

title: Fired coach Sherrone Moore felt ‚Äúsuicidal‚Äù after tense police-responded visit
content: Michigan football coach Sherrone Moore faces serious allegations. He was removed from his position and arrested. Reports suggest a disturbing incident involving an alleged affair and a confrontation. Details are emerging about a knife being present. Moore is currently in custody. The investigation is ongoing. This has sent shockwaves through the college sports world.

title: 'Dhurandhar' Day 7: Ranveer‚ÄìAkshaye spy thriller crosses Rs 200cr India, Rs 300cr global
content: Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' is a box office sensation, exceeding expectations and rewriting records. The film has shown remarkable consistency, crossing Rs 300 crore worldwide. Strong word-of-mouth and audience approval are driving its phenomenal success, particularly its action and narrative.

title: Sherrone Moore‚ÄìPaige Shiver affair rumors erupt after shocking social post
content: Sherrone Moore, former University of Michigan coach, is reportedly fired for an "inappropriate relationship" with a staff member. Speculation links him to Paige Shiver, daughter of former NFL player Jeff Shiver, after a fan noticed Moore liked her 2021 Instagram post. Shiver's social media is now private, fueling further rumors.

title: 'Nicolas Maduro‚Äôs nephews, oil tankers': US imposes new sanctions on Venezuela ‚Äî details
content: The United States imposed new sanctions on Venezuela, targeting three nephews of President Maduro's wife and six oil tankers. This action follows a US military buildup in the Caribbean and a recent seizure of a sanctioned oil tanker. The move has escalated tensions between Washington and Caracas, with Maduro denouncing the seizure as "naval piracy."

title: IndiGo offers 10k voucher to some flyers
content: IndiGo will issue Rs 10,000 travel vouchers to flyers severely impacted by disruptions on December 3-5, in addition to government-mandated compensation. This unprecedented payout follows thousands of flight cancellations, stranding passengers for hours. While the airline views these three days as the peak disruption period, affected passengers from December 6-7 are excluded from this specific voucher offer.

title: Philip Rivers could join exclusive list of athletes to suit up while being a grandparent
content: rivers retired from professional football after a 17-year career . he will be re-signing with the Indianapolis Colts . rivers' eldest daughter is a few months older than the 23-year-old rookie .

title: LSU's Kiffin set to return to Ole Miss on Sept. 19
content: the dates for the first nine-game SEC schedule were released Thursday . all eyes are on sept. 19 when Lane Kiffin and LSU return to Ole Miss . the two teams split in 2025 after they split two matchups in 2026 .

title: Everything Shams is hearing on NBA trade season: Where could Davis land?
content: 82 players signed in the offseason will become trade-eligible . 90% of the league can be moved . a top team executive says this is the "unofficial start to having real, high-stakes conversations" "this is the unofficial start" to having high stakes conversations, he says .

title: Bucs' Creamsicles, Falcons' throwbacks top Week 15 uniforms
content: the Buccaneers will wear their popular "Creamsicle" uniforms against the Atlanta Falcons on "Thursday Night Football" the combination has the iconic "Bucco Bruce" logo on the white helmets . the new york Giants wore these uniforms from 1980 to 1999 .

title: The most impactful women's recruit on every 2026 top-25 class roster
content: a look at the most impactful signee in each of the nation's top recruiting classes . the top scouts have a clearer picture of what next season will look like for many of them . last year, no one has done star power like USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb .

title: Ten (maybe 11) players to watch at NCAA volleyball tournament's Sweet 16
content: the 2025 NCAA volleyball tournament is down to its final 16 teams . can Nebraska, the no. 1 overall seed, finish undefeated and claim the program's sixth national title? will Kentucky return to the final four for the first time since winning its first national championship in 2020?

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Don't turn Liverpool chaos into Slot vs. Salah: Club bosses must step in
content: the current situation at the club is being framed in the simplest terms: Mohamed Salah vs. Arne Slot . it feels downright puerile, something straight out of the schoolyard, with fans and media playing the role of parents . slot blames little Mo for his student's poor test scores and kicks him out of class .

title: Men's class rankings: USC into top 10; Tennessee and Texas A&M join
content: the biggest winner of this most recent update was USC . both of their signees made enormous leaps in the player rankings . the Trojans jumped from no. 24 all the way to no. 9 despite not adding any commitments .

title: Man arrested for molesting and assaulting woman after brawl inside hotel
content: a 28-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly molesting, threatening, and assaulting a woman after barging into a bathroom . he is accused of threatening and threatening the woman . the e-Paper was published - December 12, 2025 12:50 am IST .

title: Follow live: Bucs hanging on to narrow lead after Falcons' failed 2-point conversion
content: TAMPA, Fla. -- The  Atlanta Falcons  and the  Tampa Bay Buccaneers  have kicked off for "Thursday Night Football" in a crucial divisional matchup. Although the Falcons (4-9) have been  eliminated from postseason contention , the struggling Bucs (7-6), who have lost four of their past five after a hot start, are tied atop the NFC South with the  Carolina Panthers . This game is a rematch of the season opener, a 23-20 Buccaneers victory. Michael Penix Jr ., who's  out for the remainder of the season  with an ACL injury, was the starting quarterback for the Falcons that day, but  Kirk Cousins  is leading the way Thursday. Meanwhile, Tampa Bay quarterback  Baker Mayfield  got some good news Wednesday when receivers  Mike Evans  and  Jalen McMillan , who will be making his season debut,  were activated  from the injured reserve list. Make sure to check back for the biggest plays from Raymond James Stadium.

title: 'We will have to do something now': Supreme Court moves on passive euthanasia plea
content: a medical board of four specialised doctors told the apex court about the condition of 31-year-old Harish Rana . he has been living with 100% disability in a permanent vegetative state for 13 years . the court decided to set in motion the next stage of the process for passive euthanasia .

title: Delhi AQI back to very poor after wind speed dips
content: Priyangi Agarwal writes on environmental and climate change issues, connecting these topics to the everyday lives of people. She tracks developments across the capital‚Äôs transport hubs‚ÄîDelhi Metro, Namo Bharat Trains, and Delhi Airport‚Äîwhile also reporting on pressing social issues. Her stories blend data analysis with voices from the ground to tell human-centred narratives. Previously stationed in western Uttar Pradesh, she focused her coverage on minority issues, health, and human rights. Read More

title: Watch: Nobel Peace Prize winner Machado out of hiding after 11 months
content: smuggled out of hiding in caracas and across the Caribbean sea in a fishing vessel . reportedly took three days to make it out of Venezuela, wearing a wig and a disguise . plans to return to Venezuela whether or not president Nicolas Maduro is ousted .

title: Arunachal accident kills 19, survivor reports after 2 days
content: Prabin Kalita is a journalist at The Times of India and is currently the Chief of Bureau (northeast). He has been reporting in mainstream Indian national media since 2001. He has been a field journalist reporting gamut of issues from India‚Äôs northeastern region and major developments in neighbouring countries like Myanmar, China, Bhutan and Bangladesh concerning India and northeastern region. He has been covering insurgency‚Äîinternal and cross-border, politics, natural calamities, environment etc. He is a post-graduate in Geological Sciences from Gauhati University. Read More

title: 781 farmer suicides in Maharashtra in 9 months
content: 781 farmer suicides in first nine months of 2025 due to loans, crop failure, excessive rainfall . in Vidarbha's Nagpur division, 296 farmers have died by suicide and in Marathwada, 212 . of the 6,669 suicides recorded in Maharashtra so far, 4,150 were farmers .
